page.title: 11TRANSPORT
page.content: Each morning at eight a minibus takes people to work in Bishop' Stortford and it brings them back about five in the evening. At school a minibus calls at school nd takes a quarter of the children home in two journeys to Stocking Pelham and Brent Pelham. The qarter of the children who live in Furneux walk to school and the other children go on school runs with other children who live near them in cars. Most children at school have a bike to get around on. Once a year there is a course for older children to teach them Cycling Proficiency and they pass if the examiner thinks they are safe on the road. It is difficult for anyone to get around if they do not have their own transport as there are only teo buses a week.
